name: Streets Across All Five Boroughs Will Ban Car Traffic For Earth Day
description: Earth Dayis approaching (Tuesday, April 22nd), and with it a time to reflect on what wonders Mother Nature provides and how best we can take care of this beautiful planet. Lucky for New Yorkers, the city has thrown an annualCar-Free Earth Dayevent for the past nine years, and this year will be no different! Earth Day is a global phenomenon kickstarted by activism in the 1960s and 1970s. The first official Earth Day even led to the creation of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Millions of Americans gathered in protest at the first Earth Day in 1970, and the celebratory day has continuously grown and evolved for climate change advocacy.

name: 170,000 Free Tulips Will Be Up For Grabs In Union Square This Weekend

(FYI, though the event is free registration will be required; tickets will be available to reserve beginningMarch17th. ) All are welcome to join in on the one-day only Tulip Day celebrations to snap some photos and evenpick their own bouquet of ten tulips for free!

name: Spring Has Sprung At Queens Botanical Garden With These Fun Activities

Located at43-50 Main St. in Flushing, in one of the most cultural neighborhoods in NYCis reason enough to take a trip! On Saturday April 12th, from 9:30 a.

name: NYCâ€™s First 7pm Sunset Of The Year Is Tonight
description: Winterin New York City is harsh enoughâ€“and after being put through the ringer withcoldest weather in two yearsweâ€™ve certainly been enjoying these past few days of warmer weather. And what makes dealing with these frigid temperatures even worse is the woefully early sunsets. From September to December, we have to deal with shorter and dark days. However,the time has finally come for later sunsets! December 21, 2024â€“theWinter Solsticeâ€“marked the shortest day of last year, with only a little over nine hours of daylight.

name: The Smell Of Pizza Can Ease Anxiety & Boost Your Mood, According To Science
description: After we recently unveiled bad news to those that love tostart their morning off with a BEC, itâ€™s only right that we now share some good news, and boy are we delivering! Apparently,pizzais good for much more than just satisfying us in the wee hours of the morning after a wild night outâ€“it can actually ease stress and anxiety and boost our mood! All things that we already couldâ€™ve told you ourselves, of course, but definitely cool to now have some science backing us up! Researchers over at the University of East Anglia in Norwich, England conducted a biometric analysis and found thatsmelling a freshly baked pizza led to alleviated stress, anxiety, and nerves. The study was conducted by Professor Oli Buckley in collaboration with Chicago Town, who, in preparation for Euros 2024, were curious if the aroma of a bakingpizzacould lessen anxiety before and during watching a football match.

name: NYC Will Gain 80+ Minutes Of Daylight This March
description: Withdaylight savinghappening on March 9th,get ready for later sunsets and longer days in the near future. And thanks to data from AccuWeather, NYC will apparentlygain more than 80 minutes of daylightbetween March 1st to March 31. According to the AccuWeather graphic, cities in the countryâ€™s northernmost regions will gain the most hours of daylight, such asSeattle, Washington, set to gain more than 100 hours of daylight this month. Inversely, southern cities like Miami and Houston will only gain around 40 to 50 minutes of daylight. Daylight Saving was first implemented in the United States after World War Ifor a slew of factors, including energy conservation, economic benefits and so on.

name: Experience Hollandâ€™s Breathtaking Tulip Fields Only 75 Minutes From NYC
description: Holland Ridge Farms, located about anhour and ten minutes from NYCin Cream Ridge, New Jersey, brings that tulip magic to the tri-state area. The farm was started by the Jansen family, whose patriarch immigrated to the U. S. from Holland in 1964. He learned how to grow tulip bulbs properly from his own father, and brought that knowledge right to NJ.

name: 16 Best Spas In NYC To Visit This Winter

name: How To Watch This Monthâ€™s Rare Planetary Alignment

name: Embark On Free â€œFirst Day Hikesâ€ At New York State Parks This New Yearâ€™s Day

Most hikes are typically one to five miles and family-friendly, but check the location youâ€™re interested in before you register. â€œThereâ€™s no better way to kick off the New Year than with family and friends at a First Day Hike to experience and enjoy the winter beauty of New Yorkâ€™s amazing scenic landscapes,â€Governor Kathy Hochulsaid in a statement. The the First Day Hike concept originated in Massachusetts in 1992, and weâ€™re glad to see the tradition has made its way across all 50 states, including the Empire State.

name: The Last Full Moon Of 2024 Will Illuminate NYC Skies This Weekend
description: Be sure to look to the night this weekend to catch the very last full moon of the year illuminating the sky in a grand display of celestial wonder! The end of year lunar event will reach peak illumination at4:02am EST on Sunday, December 15th. Donâ€™t fret if you wonâ€™t be up that early though, becauseNASAnotes that the moon willappear full for about three days,from Friday evening through Monday morning, making it a full moon weekend! The phenomenon of a full moon occurs whenEarth gets sandwiched between the Sun and the Moonand we Earthlings get a full view of the sun illuminating the moon, making it appear full. Itâ€™s really only 100% full during a lunar eclipse, howeverâ€“considering the moonâ€™s rotation and the fact that we only ever see the same side of the moon, part of it tends to be in shadow, explainsSpace.

name: Two Moons Will Simultaneously Orbit Earth This Fall
description: If youâ€™re fascinated by astronomy, get ready for an exciting event: two moons are set to orbit Earth later this month! And no this isnâ€™t an illusionâ€”itâ€™s actually asteroid 2024 PT5, known as a â€˜mini-moon. â€™ A team of scientists discovered properties of 2024 PT5 while routinely monitoring new found objects. Researchers expect the new mini-moon to remain in Earthâ€™s orbit and accompany our moon fromSeptember 29th to November 25thâ€”just days beforeTurkey Day! â€œThe object that is going to pay us a visit belongs to the Arjuna asteroid belt, a secondary asteroid belt made of space rocks that follow orbits very similar to that of Earth at an average distance to the sun of about 93 million miles (150 million kilometers),â€ research lead author and Universidad Complutense de Madrid professor Carlos de la Fuente Marcos informedSpace.

name: This Is When Fall Foliage Is Expected To Peak In NYC

According to their Fall Foliage Color Map,the NYC area is expected to reach peak foliage by late-October. This is congruent to predictions and reports in years past that typically observe peak foliage in NYC around late October/early-to-mid November. Of course,colors typically tend to appear much sooner in Upstate New York.

name: This 100-Foot Underground Waterfall Is Just 3 Hours From NYC

But what you probably donâ€™t know is that New York State even has a super rareunderground waterfall! Better known asSecret Caverns, this hidden gem actually has quite the interesting, and a bit morbid, history. In 1928, two cows fell down an 85-foot hole that led to the caverns discovery (sadly, the cows did not survive).

name: You Can Pick Your Own Sunflowers At This Farm In NJ
description: For those looking topick their own fresh sunflowers, Happy Day Farm in New Jersey is a must-visit, and even if you decide not to take any home (though, whywouldnâ€™tyou? ) the sight of a sunflower field alone is worth the visit. And we canâ€™t wait to see ayellow wonderlandat the farm in a few months!

name: Free Kayaking Will Return To Brooklyn Bridge Park For The Summer

name: A Miniature Forest Will Be Planted In NYC This Spring
description: Though called the Concrete Jungle, sometimes it seems like NYC focuses more on the concrete part of its nickname than the jungle part, butsome more greenery is heading to the city this spring! Atiny, 2,700-square-foot forest is set to be plantedon the southern end of Roosevelt Island, the first of its kind in the city! Constantly lapping at the shorelines, the strong currents of NYCâ€™s East River constantly threaten Roosevelt Island with storms and floods. To combat this, the strategic position of this mini forest willstabilize the land and capture water,serving as a living barrier against flooding and erosion and preventing pollutant runoff. SUGi, a company that works to rebuild biodiversity, restore ecosystems, and re-establish connections to nature in different communities, are the ones behind the forest,named the Manhattan Healing Forest.

name: The First Cherry Blossoms Are Officially In Bloom Right Now In NYC

name: Flaco, The Escaped Zoo Owl, Dies From Building Collision
description: Flaco, the Eurasian eagle owl that was set free from the Central Park Zoo by vandals in 2023, has reportedlydied from a building collision. The upsetting news comes just days after thedeath of NYCâ€™s beloved bald eagle Rover. According to the Wildlife Conservation Society, building residents reported Flacoâ€™s accident to the Wild Bird Fund (WBF). The WBF arrived on site and found the owl unresponsive. They declared him dead shortly thereafter.

name: 10 Best Running Routes In NYC To Do This Summer

name: NYCâ€™s First Trans-Owned Queer Boxing Gym Makes Its Home In Williamsburg
description: NYC is home to plenty ofgyms, fromboxing gymstorock climbing gyms, butOutBox is NYCâ€™s only trans-owned queer boxing gym. OutBox is the brainchild offounder and head coach Max Adler, USA amateur boxer, coach, and personal trainer with over decade of experience. After years of competing in the female division, Max transitioned and re-entered the fighting world, where hardships he experienced as a trans person in sports and fitness inspired him to create a space where Trans/GNC/LGBTQ+members of the community could come train and workout comfortably. On the schedule youâ€™ll find boxingclasses for all levels, including All-Levels Boxing & Strength, Intermediate Boxing, and their Advanced Sparring Class. They also offerLGBTQ+ classes and private training, including personal training and TGNC training, which are always Queer-led and suitable for all levels of experience.

name: The Place With The Longest Name In The U.S. Is 3.5 Hours From NYC
description: NYC is pretty straightforward when it comes to its neighborhood names, though once you head to Long Island thatâ€™s where things could potentially get a bit tricky. But wait â€™til you hear this oneâ€“the place withlongest name in the U. S. , which also happens to be the third longest in the entire world, is a lake located in Massachusetts near the Connecticut border. Located in Webster, Massachusetts, the name of the lake is45 letters longand is actually arelaxing and tranquil spotfor swimming, boating, kayaking and moreâ€“though pronouncing its name is definitely not relaxing, and is bound to make your brow furrow.

name: This Massive 21,300-Square-Foot Public Garden Oasis Is Open Year-Round In Midtown
description: Last fall, Midtown welcomed a brand newpublic park and gardenoasis(the first new green space in Midtown in decades), filled with artisan food stands, a gorgeous waterfall, and all the greenery you can imagine to convince you itâ€™s summertime year-round. Unlike anything Midtown has ever seen, the design re-envisions the buildingâ€™s public space as a generously expanded, densely vegetated garden, according toSnÃ¸hettaâ€™s website. This urban garden includes48 trees, 200 shrubs, 6,300 bulb plants, and 10,000 herbaceous understory plants. These, alongside other plantings, willencourage a variety of birds, butterflies, and other pollinatorsto thrive in this environment, creating the ultimate shared urban habitat.

name: 10 Gorgeous Photos Of Wisteria Blooming Around NYC

This time of year is an especially good time to spy wisteriaâ€”the long-living, drippy purple-vining flowers that climb high and bloom from spring into early summer. They have a penchant for brightening up the greenery and vines that cover old New York townhouses around this time of year.

name: These Public Plazas Are Perfect For Soaking Up The NYC Sunshine

But green spaces arenâ€™t the only places to hangout in the warm weatherâ€“weâ€™re talking aboutpublic plazas, such as these two in Lower Manhattan. In July of last year, NYC Parks Commissioner Sue Donoghue and NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) Commissioner Rohit T. Aggarwala cut the ribbon ontwo plazas in Lower Manhattan, giving the public space to enjoy the great outdoors at the intersection of Grand and Lafayette Street and East 4th Street between Bowery and Lafayette. â€œAs the weather heats up, our public spaces become only more important to keeping New Yorkers cool and able to enjoy the outdoors,â€ saidNYC Mayor Eric Adams in apress release.

name: 12 Stunning Secret Gardens Hidden In New York City
description: It can be easy to forget about the parks, courtyards, and secret gardens when you think of the â€œconcrete jungle,â€ but if you take a stroll through your neighborhood youâ€™ll definitely stumble across some greenery. Now that spring is here and withcherry blossoms peakingin some parts of the city, we canâ€™t get enough of the fresh vegetation. Aside from the large park areas andbotanical gardens, there are countless community parks, restaurants, shops, and courtyards covered in lush foliage. Here are some of the cutest secret gardens around the city: This lovely spot, which was built in 1854, is called Grove Court and is located on Grove Street in the West Village. It didnâ€™t used to be the lush oasis it is today, but thereâ€™s no denying that it is now one of the cityâ€™s many hidden gems.

name: These Outdoor Reading Rooms At The Brooklyn Library Are The Perfect Place To Curl Up On A Sunny Day

The outdoor reading rooms came about during the pandemic, when the Brooklyn Public Library told us they were working tirelessly to make sure they were still able to connect with patrons who rely on them for books and other resources. â€œWe are always thinking: if we cannot have patrons come into the library, how can we bring our services out to them? â€a spokesperson said.

name: 5 Best Places To Catch The Changing Fall Foliage In New York State

While some of these locations are way further than others (basically in Canada) we promise, the beauty is worthy of the drive. So although we can fight all day aboutwhere â€œupstateâ€ really begins, at the end of the day what we really mean here is anything above Westchester County.

name: NYC Floating Park â€˜Little Islandâ€™ Is Officially Open

It is described as â€œa new public park designed for New Yorkers of all ages to enjoy nature and artâ€ and â€œan innovative green space featuring open lawns and gentle pathways, community spaces and performance venues. â€ And now, you can actually see that in person. The free public park is located at 13th St.

name: Treat Yourself To One Of These Incredibly Relaxing And Peaceful NYC Spa Treatments
description: Stepping into a tranquil oasis, surrounded bycalming scents and soft music, the allure of spa treatments can transport your mind to a state of utter relaxation. In a bustling city, the peaceful sanctuary of the spa brings a much-needed respite for the mind, body and soul.

name: The High Line Officially Reopens Today
description: The gorgeous elevated Park, which was created on the former New York Central Railroad tracks, runs 1. 5 miles through the West Side of Manhattan and has been a favorite for New Yorkers since it opened in 2009. People of course needed fresh air and could stay at least six feet apart from others in wide open park spaces, but the High Line presented a more difficult issue because it has narrower pathways and not as much open space for people to spread out. To help mitigate that during reopening, they will be usingtimed-entry passes. They are free and are now available on the Parkâ€™s websitehere.

name: The High Line Is NYCâ€™s First Park To Close During The COVID-19 Pandemic
description: As of now, other NYC Parks (Central, Madison Square, Washington Square, etc. ) and public playgrounds remain open. The NYC Parks Department is posting updatesonline here. People of course need fresh air and can stay at least six feet apart from others in wide open park spaces, but the High Line presented a more difficult issue because it has rather narrow pathways and not as much open space for people to spread out. In their official statement, they echoed this sentiment, saying, â€œFriends of the High Lineâ€™s Board of Directors, in consultation with senior staff, has decided not to open the High Line.

name: 10 Places Where You Can Get A Free Workout In NYC
description: However, New York City offers plenty of opportunities for free workouts. Seriously! You just have to be willing to get up and find them. Leave the wallet at home, and get started onworking outthose New Years resolutions. At these spots, cost is no longer a viable excuse.

name: When to see Wednesdayâ€™s Once-in-a-Lifetime Lunar Event in NYC
description: On January 31, a blue moon, supermoon and total lunar eclipse converge to cause a â€œbloodâ€ moon. This astronomical coincidence hasnâ€™t been recorded in over 150 years. Though the spectacle will be best seen on the west coast, where they will enjoy the phenomena from start to finish, it will still be worth catching here in New York. Gordon Johnson, blogger at NASA said: â€œUnfortunately, eclipse viewing will be more challenging in the Eastern time zone. The eclipse begins at 5:51 AM ET, as the Moon is about to set in the western sky, and the sky is getting lighter in the east.
